revised_title: Ionization of Gases Produced During Fermentation: Electrical Effects Accompanying the Decomposition of Organic Compounds
tldr: The authors investigate the electrical effects accompanying the decomposition of organic compounds, specifically focusing on the ionization of gases produced during fermentation. They observe that the CO2 escaping from the fermentation of a saccharine solution carries an electric charge and is ionized. The study provides insights into the relationship between fermentation and the generation of electrical effects.
